Modules¶

class constGlobal.ConstantsGlobal¶

Bases: object

A class to hold global constants related to the physical properties of the world.

Attributes are immutable to prevent accidental modification outside of class definition.

property Patm¶

Atmospheric pressure at sea level (Pa)

property Pvap¶

Vapor pressure of sea water at 25 degrees Celsius (Pa)

property g¶

Acceleration due to gravity (m/s^2)

property rho¶

Density of sea water (kg/m^3)

class constUnitConvert.ConstantsUnitConversion¶

Bases: object

A class to hold constants for various unit conversions.

property N2kN¶

Convert Newtons to kilo Newtons

property N2mTon¶

Convert Newtons to metric tons

property W2MW¶

Convert Watts to MegaWatts

property W2kW¶

Convert Watts to kiloWatts

property cms2ms¶

Convert cm/s to m/s

property euro2dollar¶

Convert euros to dollars

property ft2m¶

Convert feet to meters

property hrs2days¶

Convert hours to days

property kE2E¶

Convert kilo euros to euros

property m2km¶

Convert meters to kilometers

property m2mile¶

Convert meters to miles

property m32cm3¶

Convert cubic meters to cubic centimeters

property mile2m¶

Convert miles to meters

property rads2rpm¶

Convert rad/s to rpm

property sec2days¶

Convert seconds to days

class module_rotor.RotorData(filename, cpmin_filename=None)¶

Bases: object

A class to represent rotor data and perform various calculations related to rotor performance.

filename¶

The filename of the rotor data file.

Type:

str

cpmin_filename¶

The filename of the Cpmin data file.

Type:

str, optional

data¶

The rotor data.

Type:

DataFrame

tsr¶

The tip-speed ratio values.

Type:

ndarray

cp¶

The Cp values.

Type:

ndarray

ct¶

The Ct values.

Type:

ndarray

cpmin¶

The Cpmin values.

Type:

ndarray

CpOpt¶

The maximum Cp value.

Type:

float

TSROpt¶

The corresponding TSR value for the maximum Cp.

Type:

float

TSRmax¶

The maximum TSR value where either Cp or Ct first becomes zero.

Type:

float

calculate_cq(tsr)¶

Calculate Cq = Cp / TSR for a given TSR.

Parameters:

tsr (float or ndarray) – The tip-speed ratio.

Returns:

The calculated Cq value.

Return type:

float or ndarray

find_max_cp()¶

Find the maximum Cp point and the corresponding TSR value.

Returns:

  • float – The maximum Cp value.

  • float – The corresponding TSR value.

find_tsr_max()¶

Find the maximum TSR value where either Cp or Ct first becomes zero.

Returns:

The maximum TSR value where either Cp or Ct first becomes zero.

Return type:

float

get_cp(tsr)¶

Interpolate Cp value for a given TSR.

Parameters:

tsr (float or ndarray) – The tip-speed ratio.

Returns:

The interpolated Cp value.

Return type:

float or ndarray

get_cpmin(tsr)¶

Interpolate Cpmin value for a given TSR.

Parameters:

tsr (float or ndarray) – The tip-speed ratio.

Returns:

The interpolated Cpmin value.

Return type:

float or ndarray

get_cq(tsr)¶

Interpolate Cq value for a given TSR.

Parameters:

tsr (float or ndarray) – The tip-speed ratio.

Returns:

The interpolated Cq value.

Return type:

float or ndarray

get_ct(tsr)¶

Interpolate Ct value for a given TSR.

Parameters:

tsr (float or ndarray) – The tip-speed ratio.

Returns:

The interpolated Ct value.

Return type:

float or ndarray

load_cpmin_data()¶

Load Cpmin data from a JSON file if provided, otherwise assume Cpmin is all -1.

Returns:

The Cpmin values corresponding to the TSR values.

Return type:

ndarray

load_data()¶

Load rotor data from a text file.

Returns:

The rotor data.

Return type:

DataFrame

prepare_data()¶

Ensure Cp values are positive and saturate negative values to zero. Ensure Cpmin values are negative or zero.

class module_vessel.VesselData(height=None, density=None, theta_m=None, alpha=None, Cd=None, phi=None, user_defined=False, vessel_properties=None)¶

Bases: object

A class to represent the data and properties of a vessel.

height¶

Height of the vessel.

Type:

float

density¶

Density of the vessel material.

Type:

float

theta_m¶

Mooring line angle in radians.

Type:

float

alpha¶

Aspect ratio for the vessel.

Type:

float

Cd¶

Drag coefficient.

Type:

float

phi¶

Pitch constraint in radians.

Type:

float

user_defined¶

Flag indicating if the vessel properties are user-defined.

Type:

bool

vessel_properties¶

Dictionary containing user-defined vessel properties.

Type:

dict

width¶

Width of the vessel.

Type:

float

Fmoor¶

Mooring force.

Type:

float

length¶

Length of the vessel.

Type:

float

Khs¶

Hydrostatic stiffness.

Type:

float

Kphi¶

Pitch hydrostatic stiffness.

Type:

float

GM¶

Metacentric height.

Type:

float

VesselVolume¶

Volume of the vessel.

Type:

float

h_s¶

Submerged height; Half of the vessel height.

Type:

float

calculate_vessel_drag_force(Uinf)¶

Calculate the drag force exerted on the vessel.

Parameters:

Uinf (float) – Free stream velocity (m/s)

Returns:

The drag force exerted on the vessel (N)

Return type:

float

calculate_vessel_properties(mass_of_turbines, Uinf, Ft, number_of_turbines)¶

Calculate the vessel properties based on the given parameters.

Parameters:

  • mass_of_turbines (float) – Mass of the turbine.

  • Uinf (array) – Array of flow speeds.

  • Ft (array) – Array of thrust forces.

  • number_of_turbines (int) – Number of turbines.

print_all_attributes()¶

Print all attributes of the VesselData object.

set_default_properties()¶

Set default properties for the vessel.

set_vessel_properties()¶

Set vessel properties from user-defined vessel geometry.

class module_constraint_checker.ConstraintChecker(Radius, CpminFunc)¶

Bases: object

cavitation_constraint(TSR, Uinf_adjusted, RotorSpeed, dHub)¶

Check for cavitation constraints.

Parameters: - TSR: Array of TSR values. - Uinf_adjusted: Array of adjusted flow speeds. - RotorSpeed: Array of rotor speeds. - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - Array: Cavitation constraint values (must be greater than 0 to be valid).

check_cavitation_constraint(TSR, Uinf_adjusted, RotorSpeed, dHub)¶

Check if the cavitation constraint is satisfied.

Parameters: - TSR: Array of TSR values. - Uinf_adjusted: Array of adjusted flow speeds. - RotorSpeed: Array of rotor speeds. - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - bool: True if the cavitation constraint is satisfied, False otherwise.

check_depth_constraint(dHub)¶

Check if the depth constraint is satisfied.

Parameters: - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - bool: True if the depth constraint is satisfied, False otherwise.

check_pitch_constraint(vessel, Uinf, Ft, dHub, number_of_turbines)¶

Check if the pitch constraint is satisfied.

Parameters: - vessel: VesselData object. - Uinf: Array of flow speeds. - Ft: Array of thrust forces. - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - bool: True if the pitch constraint is satisfied, False otherwise.

check_pitch_stiffness_constraint(vessel)¶

Check if the pitch stiffness constraint is satisfied.

Parameters: - vessel: VesselData object.

Returns: - bool: True if the pitch stiffness constraint is satisfied, False otherwise.

depth_constraint(dHub)¶

Check if the rotor is fully submerged.

Parameters: - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - Array: Depth constraint values (must be greater than 0 to be valid).

designed_pitch_constraint(vessel, Uinf, Ft, number_of_turbines)¶

Check for pitch constraints for a designed vessel.

Parameters: - vessel: VesselData object. - Uinf: Array of flow speeds. - Ft: Array of thrust forces.

Returns: - Array: Pitch constraint values (must be greater than 0 to be valid).

pitch_constraint(vessel, Uinf, Ft, dHub, number_of_turbines)¶

Check for pitch constraints.

Parameters: - vessel: VesselData object. - Uinf: Array of flow speeds. - Ft: Array of thrust forces. - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - Array: Pitch constraint values (must be greater than 0 to be valid).

user_defined_pitch_constraint(vessel, Uinf, Ft, dHub, number_of_turbines)¶

Check for pitch constraints for a user-defined vessel.

Parameters: - vessel: VesselData object. - Uinf: Array of flow speeds. - Ft: Array of thrust forces. - dHub: Array of hub depths.

Returns: - Array: Pitch constraint values (must be greater than 0 to be valid).

find_optimal_constant_speed()¶
flowAtDepth(FlowSpeed, Radius, dHub, dMoor)¶

Adjusts flow speed at a turbine’s hub depth based on the mooring depth and the flow speed at the surface.

Parameters: - FlowSpeed: Flow speed at the surface in m/s. - Radius: Radius of the turbine in meters. - dHub: Depth of the turbine hub in meters. - dMoor: Depth of the mooring in meters.

Returns: - Uout: Adjusted flow speed at the hub depth in m/s.
